definition: to weave/to plait/to organize/to group/to arrange/to edit/to compile/to write/to compose/to fabricate

sentences.english: This is the edited version of my speech.
sentences.chinese: 这是我的演讲稿选编本。

sentences.english: Recommendations are to establish guidance and publishing case subjects.
sentences.chinese: 分别确立指导性案例的选编和公布主体。

sentences.english: They selected and compiled an anthology of essays according to criticisms on the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 他们根据网路的评论，选编了一部散文集。

sentences.english: These initial twenty one materials have been selected by Feng Yuan.
sentences.chinese: 这二十一篇文献及其简介由冯媛选编。

sentences.english: There is A Copy of Libai's Poems selected and copied by my great grandfather himself at my home.
sentences.chinese: 我家有一本太祖爷爷自己选编并抄写的《李白诗钞》。

sentences.english: To select and compile textbooks in foreign language training in enterprise is the key factor of successful teaching.
sentences.chinese: 企业外语培训中教材选编是教学成功与否的关键因素。

sentences.english: That's certainly what this compilation has me thinking.
sentences.chinese: 这是我在选编时理所当然的想到的。

sentences.english: Mr. Wang Yilian edited Ar Zhong's Black Lyric Volume(about 150 pages).
sentences.chinese: 王一梁选编《阿钟黑色抒情诗卷》，约150页。

definition: a series of books/a collection of books
to include (in a collection)/to put together (stories, poems etc)/to record/to employ/to recruit
